CatDescriptText: Patsy Bradshaw, housewife, Terrace Village and Frances Freeman, postal worker, North Side, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, October 29, 1960, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think there is too much emphasis placed on sports in high school and college?"  Mrs. Bradshaw's answer reads: "The set-ups in high school and college are nice and there's not too much emphasis on sports."  Mrs. Freeman's answer reads: "Truthfully, I don't think there's too much emphasis on education."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Patsy Bradshaw wearing coat with fur collar, holding infant with dark cap, standing on sidewalk of Smithfield Street, Downtown; Portrait of Frances Freeman wearing light colored coat with wide collar and eyeglasses, standing in front of C.A. Michel sign, Smithfield Street, Downtown
